metadata.title: The Ultimate Foe
metadata.time_reference: During the Trial of a Time Lord and events surrounding the High Council of Gallifrey

releases.details: Released with the other Trial of a Time Lord stories in a TARDIS-shaped tin
Part of The Trial of a Time Lord boxset
special_features: Commentary by Colin Baker, Tony Selby, Chris Clough, and Pip & Jane Baker (Part 14)
The Making of The Ultimate Foe documentary
Audio Commentary featuring Colin Baker, Chris Clough, Tony Selby, and Pip and Jane Baker (Part 14)
Untransmitted Doctor Who parody by French & Saunders

notes: This was Colin Baker's last appearance as the Doctor.
Baker was fired after significant controversy.
Pip and Jane Baker were commissioned to finish the story after Robert Holmes's death.
This story marked the last appearances of the Inquisitor and the Valeyard in the original series.
A major character facelift for the show following Baker's departure.
Part fourteen is the last episode of Doctor Who to air in a Saturday timeslot.

in_universe_mythology: The Matrix as a neural simulation for Time Lords.
The concept of the Valeyard as an amalgamation of the Doctor's darker impulses.
real_world_cultural_references: Quotes from Hamlet and references to Sydney Carton from 'A Tale of Two Cities'.
The Doctor compares the Valeyard to Ananias and Baron Münchhausen.

continuity_notes: Explains the events that led to the overthrow of the High Council.
Links to the future narrative concerning the Doctor's adventures and character development.

plot.plot_summary: In this finale, during his trial, the Doctor must confront the Valeyard's manipulation of evidence and eventual reveal the truth with the Master’s help, leading to a showdown in the Matrix where illusion and reality intertwine intensely, culminating in the Doctor's acceptance of a death sentence that is not what it seems.
